paragraphs.text: What is not being reported in Azerbaijan.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: While
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: global media appears to be focused on debating the limitations on free speech in France following the attack on the French satirical newspaper Charlie Hebdo
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: it is worth remembering that France is not the only country whose media professionals are targeted
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: For years, journalists in Azerbaijan have suffered harsh penalties for defending their freedom of speech- from prison sentences to interrogation and the confiscation of broadcasting equipment
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: On December 26, at around 10:30am, a group of police officers and investigators stormed the Baku bureau of Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: ransacking the company's safe, seizing company documents, the official seal and equipment
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: while
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: keeping the staff hostage in a conference room for over five hours
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Once the search was over, the office was sealed shut
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The staff was let go only to be forcefully summoned a day later at the heavy crimes unit of the state prosecutor's office for questioning
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: In just a few days, over 30 former and current staff members of RFE/RL were questioned, including the bureau's cleaner
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: On December 30, the government accused the radio and its staff of espionage, money laundering and appropriation of funds as part of the ongoing criminal investigation against foreign-funded entities in Azerbaijan
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Similar measures were taken against Institute for Reporters' Freedom and Safety (IRFS), the Media Rights Institute, and International Research and Exchanges Board (IREX)
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The offices of all three were raided in August and sealed shut with IREX leaving the country shortly after
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The director of IRFS, Emin Huseynov, remains in hiding
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Consistent targeting
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: This is not the first time the RFE/RL station, locally called Azadliq Radio (Liberty Radio) is targeted by the authorities
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In 2009, its FM broadcast was shut down
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: BBC radio service and Voice of America followed suit
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: For years, the police harassed the radio's reporters, often confiscating or breaking their equipment or detaining them for endless hours of interrogation
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: On December 5, Azadliq Radio investigative journalist and the host of the radio's daily show, Khadija Ismayilova, was arrested and placed in pre-trial detention for two months
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Accused of "incitement to suicide" or "an attempt to suicide" as per Article 125 of the Criminal Code, Ismayilova remains in jail
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: even though
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: her accuser, Tural Mustafayev, has withdrawn his complaint
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Mustafayev had accused Ismayilova of inciting him to attempt suicide and "insulting his honour and dignity on social networks and among her friends following the break-up of their relations and his intention to marry another woman"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: On December 30, the Baku Court of Appeal dismissed Ismayilova's appeal for house arrest
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Prior to this charge, Ismayilova was already facing an unrelated criminal trial for defamation linked to her posting a document on Facebook revealing the identity of a man who was an informant for Azerbaijan's intelligence services
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: In October, when travelling for a conference in Prague, Ismayilova was prevented from leaving the country
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: A little over a week before this trip, Ismayilova was searched and detained for four hours at Baku International Airport
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: She was returning from Strasbourg where she talked about the deteriorating human rights conditions in Azerbaijan
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Her investigative work uncovered many of the hidden and illegal business dealings of the ruling Aliyev family and other government officials
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: for which she is recognised internationally
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Ismayilova is the recipient of Global Shining Award, the Gerd Bucerius Free Press of Eastern Europe Award, the Courage of Journalism Award, and named one of the Brave Thinkers of the world by Atlantic magazine
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Was it a coincidence that Ismayilova's detention came just a day after the country's chief of staff, Ramiz Mehdiyev, accused Ismayilova of treason and being a foreign spy?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Or that the radio station was raided and then closed in another few weeks time?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In his 60-page diatribe on "Western Colonialism", Mehdiyev wrote:"Their main concern is lip service to their bosses abroad and keeping good relations with them
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: The example is Azadliq Radio's journalist Kahdija Ismayilova
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Together with her colleague 'friends' she puts on anti-Azerbaijani shows, makes absurd statements, openly demonstrates destructive attitude towards well-known members of the Azerbaijani community, and spreads insulting lies
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: It is clear this sort of defiance pleases Ms Ismayilova's patrons abroad."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: He concluded:"Overall there is an understanding within the society that Azadliq Radio and its employees are on a disgusting path
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: There is no need to prove that provision of false information is the same as working for the foreign secret service
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: This is treason
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: This is what journalists and people with a healthy mindset would think
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the symbol of democracy is Khadija Ismayilova
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: then it is awful to imagine what future awaits the society."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Siyavush Novruzov, an MP from the ruling party, agrees
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In an interview with a local news site, Novruzov said:"Every place that works for foreign intelligence and the Armenian lobby should be searched."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: The Armenian lobby is just another popular tool used by government circles to punish dissent in Azerbaijan
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Despite its support for Track Two diplomacy initiatives, Aliyev's regime was quick to accuse Leyla Yunus and Rauf Mirkadirov of treason and spying for Armenia this year
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Both Yunus and Mirkadirov have been engaged in public diplomacy initiatives pressing for reconciliation between Armenia and Azerbaijan for over a decade
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The authorities were fully aware of their work for years
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And yet
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: in what has been by far the most unprecedented year of crackdowns, Azerbaijan continues to maintain a steady relationship with Europe and the image of a transforming country, young and rich, and eager to spend so long as its critics keep quiet
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: With many of the country's prominent advocates, lawyers, and journalists in jail; independent media platforms under attack; and only a handful of international non-governmental organisations left in the country, there is little hope for the country's positive transformation anytime soon
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: So long as President Ilham Aliyev keeps saying there are no political prisoners and no limitations on freedom of speech in Azerbaijan- conjuring the illusion of a democratic country- little is going to change in this country
paragraphs.label: assumption
